intro: Clavija wallnoeferi, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a woody stem with thick, leathery leaves. It is adapted to cold climates and can thrive in areas with limited sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
